entries.tagline: A powerful story about individuality, rebellion and poetry at a strict boys' school.
entries.fullText: The novel “Dead Poet Society” by N.H. Kleinbaum is the bookish adaptation of the movie with the same title starring our beloved Robin Williams. This book is perfect for truly anyone. No matter if you just like to suffer and want to test how many tears you can shed over a bunch of fictional boys that deserved better or if you simply are too good to just watch the movie but still want to have an opinion. This book will teleport you into eternal autumn (and possibly depression) with it’s truly touching and raw characters. It paints a picture of such relatable human troubles that no matter at which point in life everyone will relate to. Once you’re obsessed with the characters you will start to read and analyse every single reference to poetry, scriptures or bible verses. This will make you realize how detailed the parallels and metaphors, how thought through and simply breathtaking the scene settings are. It will make you want to peel back layer after layer of characters, their past and dreams (and if you have not watched the movie at this point in your journey – what even are you doing?). However, be warned. If you watched the movie first (and even if you didn’t), you might want to skip some pages. Because in this adaptation the author made some questionable choices of adding (completely unnecessary and out of character) subplots that might make you hate some of your favourite characters.
